name: spectrally
content:
spectrally adverb
(COLOURS OR WAVES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
physics
  specialized relating to or produced by a spectrum (= the set of colours into which a beam of light can be separated, or a range of light or radio waves): The stars appeared to spectrally shift from white to yellow and then to brown and green. It is the most spectrally efficient wireless broadband technology available.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sounds of speech and noise had been spectrally separated.All the new homes will include spectrally selective glass to block ultraviolet light and excessive heat.The X-ray output was spectrally resolved.
